message.content:
Below is one systematic way to “read off” the two pictured assemblies and match them to the block‐dictionary images without rotating or recoloring any piece.  I have broken the solution into three parts as requested.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE 
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
●  There are effectively two separate sub‐structures:

  A)  The “little house” on the left (4 blocks total):
     – Base: Two identical red arch‐blocks side by side.  
     – Roof: Two orange wedge‐blocks meeting at the top.

  B)  The taller “tower” on the right (10 blocks total):
     – Columns (floor–level): Two orange cylinders in front plus a taller stack (3 cylinders) toward the back.  
     – Yellow Platform: A single wide, yellow rectangular prism bridging the two front columns.  
     – Second‐story “arch”: A red arch‐block set on the platform.  
     – Yellow half‐circle piece behind that arch (functionally a small cylinder in yellow).  
     – Two orange wedges as “roofs”: one atop the little arch‐and‐cylinder unit, and another on the very top of the tall rear cylinder stack.

●  Layer / Count Summary:
  – Left House: 4 pieces (2 red arches + 2 orange wedges).  
  – Right Tower: 10 pieces (5 orange cylinders total, 1 yellow rectangular platform, 1 red arch, 1 small yellow cylinder/“half‐circle,” and 2 orange wedges).  
  – Overall = 14 blocks, arranged in (at least) three vertical layers (ground‐level arches/cylinders, the yellow platform layer, and the red‐arch + wedge roofs above).

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE CORRECT BLOCKS (AND THEIR INDICES) 
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

From the reference sheet (second image), the following choice reproduces both color and orientation exactly (no rotation allowed):

• Red arches → Dictionary index 1  (use three of these in total: two for the left “house,” one for the tower’s small arch).  
• Orange cylinders (vertical) → Dictionary index 9  (use five total: two for front columns, three stacked at rear).  
• Yellow rectangular platform → Dictionary index 8  (one wide, horizontal yellow prism).  
• Small yellow “half‐cylinder” behind the top arch → approximated by the small yellow cylinder at index 12 (placed so that only half is visible, matching the half‐circle silhouette).  
• Orange wedges → We need four wedges in total.  We can use index 14 and 16 (both slopes oriented “left–right”) in pairs.  Two go on the left‐house roof; the other two top out the tower’s second‐story arch and the rear cylinder stack.

Thus the required block‐index list (with quantities) is:

• Index 1:  3 copies  
• Index 8:  1 copy  
• Index 9:  5 copies  
• Index 12: 1 copy  
• Index 14: 2 copies  
• Index 16: 2 copies  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS 
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one natural order in which to place them.  (You may, of course, reorder as convenient, but each step “moves” one block of a given index.)

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 1   (left‐house: first red arch)  
  Step2:  Move block with index 1   (left‐house: second red arch)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 14  (left‐house: first orange wedge roof)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 16  (left‐house: second orange wedge roof)

  Step5:  Move block with index 9   (tower front: left column)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 9   (tower front: right column)  
  Step7:  Move block with index 9   (tower rear: bottom cylinder)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 9   (tower rear: middle cylinder)  
  Step9:  Move block with index 9   (tower rear: top cylinder)  

  Step10: Move block with index 8   (yellow bridging platform)  
  Step11: Move block with index 1   (red arch atop the platform)  
  Step12: Move block with index 12  (small yellow cylinder behind arch)  
  Step13: Move block with index 14  (orange wedge roof on second‐story arch)  
  Step14: Move block with index 16  (final orange wedge atop the tall rear column)
}

Following the above steps (and using the listed dictionary blocks in exactly these orientations) will recreate the target scene as shown in the first image.
